column4: Hey, does anyone know a good forum post/page explaining how to get two video cards to work? I haven't been able to find anything useful on ubuntuforums...
what graphic card?
system>admin...>hardware drivers
and the problem is?
with nvidia you have to use nvidia-settings. run in a terminal « gksudo nvidia-settings & »
there is button to save the config to the xorg file use it when you are done
press shift during boot for the grub menu to appear
any idea what the command is to reset the graphics drivers to default?
I broke stuff by installing a proprietry nvidia driver...
the recovery menu should have an option to restore Xwindows
okay thanks, will give it a try... :D
that didn't work, shift did nothing ;p
can you switch to a VT ? crtl + alt + f1
no, its crashed on the black screen. Keyboard doesnt do anything- no lights etc
So..uh any other ways to get into a recovery console?
what exactly did you do? edit a file? or what
No, I just changed the driver from the most up to date nvidia driver to a slightly older one to try and resolve a problem. Rebooted and it blackscreens
that is from the hardware drivers utility, not manually
i see; maybe just moving /etc/X11/xorg.conf out of the way ( from a livecd ) works
Okay, thanks, I'll try that!
mount the ubuntu partition and use « sudo mv /mount/point/etc/X11/xorg.conf /mount/point/etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak  »
no problem
